pros: Leadership listens. Staff appreciation is shown and opportunities to share your appreciation of your coworkers is also available. A lot of well seasoned staff, wanting to mentor new staff to ensure your success. Positioning the hospital to be the most accessible and sustainable hospital in the area, ensuring that they offer top notch care for all ages. If you are wanting to be a part of a team that encourages growth as a whole and individually, this is where you want to work.
cons: Poor parking for staff, parking building is not attached to the hospital. Don’t recognize significant holidays like Memorial Day, Christmas Eve, could offer more vacation benefits at the start.

review_title: It’s okay for a starter job
pros: It was a good start. They try to show their appreciation to their staff members in different ways.
cons: The hospital treated nurses and doctors better than everyone during Covid. They got free meals because they came in contact and worked long hours with patients. While everyone else who worked long hours and were on direct contact with patients didn’t. They were constantly gifted things throughout the day. Felt unwanted. Radiology management is horrible. Is a buddy buddy system and if you’re not in the clique, then you will be treated as such.

pros: Good spirited and well meaning upper management of the hospital
cons: No covered walkway from the parking garage

pros: Loved my coworkers and the doctors I worked with.
cons: Terrible pay and unsafe staffing ratios

pros: I liked being in the medical setting. Most of the staff including doctors and nurses are very nice.
cons: Same old same old day in and day out. Really no way to advance in this position unless you go into the medical field. Management sees you as a number and statistic and sometimes tells you your job position is not really needed.

pros: Chance to learn and grow as a professional
cons: Terrible schedule, high turnover rate, short staff.

pros: Great team to work with

pros: Offers specialty units not offered by other area hospitals
cons: The pay is low in comparison to other area hospitals

pros: interview process was easy, friendly people, HR was great to work with
cons: low pay, overworked, priority is not their employees, let's very shady/inappropriate things go on with employees with no repercussions

pros: Great atmosphere and friendly coworkers
cons: Large company so you are replaceable

pros: It is a religious institution
cons: The hospital was better when it was run by the nuns.  They are management heavy. They do not have enough staff with high turnover on TELE/rENAL and ER. There are 4 colleges in the area so they do not go out of their way for the nursing staff.  They do not listen to the floor nurses about how to better care for their patients. New nurses get in their 1 to 2 years and then are gone except on OB/Labor Delivery.  They can easily replace with new nurses but the experience ones do not stay .long .

job_title: RN Staff Nurse OR in Monroe, LA
pros: I miss all the wonderful people I worked with so long, they became my family! St Francis provided me with wonderful benefits throughout my 20+ years, really took are of me and my family.
cons: They didn't always keep up with the latest equipment.  Some of my co workers worked way too many hours; I think management didn't want to hire enough people.

pros: Management staff seems to really care about employees for the most part.
cons: As with any hospital you won't agree/like everyone.  Sometimes unit managers seems to frown upon swapping units.

pros: The health care is great and benefits are decent if you’ve been around long enough.
cons: Pay is lower compared to other hospitals.

pros: I was provided stability for many years.
cons: Having to work short staffed was always an issue.

pros: Pharmacy available to employees, great cafeteria
cons: Nothing, I enjoy working here.
